query package¶

Submodules¶

query.fuzzyset module¶

class query.fuzzyset.FuzzySet(elements=None)¶

Bases: object

A simplistic (but efficient) implementation of a fuzzy set class and the basic operations (union, intersection, subtraction and complement) according to the standard definitions.

complement(universe=set())¶
cut(alpha=1.0)¶
static from_dictionary(dictionary)¶

Generates a FuzzySet from a dictionary.

Args:
dictionary: A dictionary in which the values are numerical.
Returns:
A FuzzySet object with normalised weights based on the input dictionary.

class query.fuzzyset.ProvFuzzySet(elements=None)¶

Bases: query.fuzzyset.FuzzySet

FuzzySet used to normalize the scores of provenances in regards to user queries.

static from_list_dictionary(list_dictionary)¶

Generates a new ProvFuzzySet from a dictionary of lists.

Parameters:list_dictionary – A dictionary of lists.
Returns:A ProvFuzzySet representing the dictionary.
sort(reverse=False, limit=0)¶

Returns a sorted version of this ProvFuzzySet.

Parameters:
  • reverse – Optional. Default: False. Whether the order is to be descending, by membership.
  • limit – Optional. Default: 0. The number of limits to return.
Returns:

An iterator to iterate over the sorted contents.

query.queryresult module¶

class query.queryresult.QueryResult(min_weight=0.5, alias=None, relation_type='all', lesser_edges=True)¶

Bases: object

Wrapper over the processed text files to produce a graph in JSON format that can be displayed to the user.

filter_relevant(relevant: query.fuzzyset.FuzzySet)¶

Filters the relation tuples by the min_weight specified. Relation tuples that are below the specified value will be excluded from the result.

Parameters:relevant – A FuzzySet containing the (token, weight) tuples for the query terms.
Returns:A FuzzySet with the values that were below the min_weight threshhold.
generate_statement_graph(max_nodes, max_edges)¶

Generates the graph object for the query. Only the top most relevant nodes and edges are in the graph.

Parameters:
  • max_nodes – The maximum number of nodes in the graph.
  • max_edges – The maximum number of edges in the graph.
Returns:

A Graph object representing the result graph.
generate_statement_nodes(max_nodes)¶

Generates the nodes that exist in the query-graph.

Parameters:max_nodes – The maximum number of nodes.
Returns:A list of nodes that make up the graph.
get_top_provenances(top=10)¶

Returns the highest scoring provenances, sorted descendingly.

Parameters:top – The number of provenances to return.
Returns:A list of the highest scoring provenances, sorted descendingly.
static load_parameters()¶

Returns a dictionary of visualization parameters used for the graph.

static load_relation2prov(path=None)¶

Loads the mapping of relation tuples to the provenances. The format is: (token, related_to, token2): [ (provenance, weight), …]

Parameters:path – Optional. Default: paths.RELATION_PROVENANCES_PATH. The path to the file of tuple -> provennces mapping, as created in index_step.
Returns:A dictionary of relation tripe -> provenance mappings.
static load_relation_sets(path='E:\\workspace\\data\\expressionsexperimental')¶

Loads the processed relationsets from index_step. Returns a dictionary mapping tokens to a list of tuples in the format:

token: [ (token2, weight), … ]

This dictionary can be used to access the tokens that are related to another token by accessing the dictionary by key.

Parameters:path – Optional. Default: paths.RELATION_WEIGHT_PATH. The path where the shortform of relation mappings is stored.
static load_token2related(path='E:\\workspace\\data\\relations\\relations.tsv.gz', relation_type='all')¶

Loads the mapping of tokens to the related tokens.

Parameters:
  • path – Optional. Default: os.path.join(paths.RELATIONS_PATH, “relations.tsv.gz”). The path to where the mapping of triples to provenances is stored.
  • relation_type – Optional. Default: “all”. The type of relation to be considered.
Returns:

A dictionary containing a mapping of SPO-triples to (provenance, score) tuples.
populate_dictionaries()¶

Prepares the ranking of tokens / relations for use with the graph.

  1. Get all tokens possibly relevant to the query
  2. Get all triples related to the token in some way
  3. Filter out those that don’t have relevance to the query or that token
  4. Get the degree of membership of the token <-> the query
  5. Multiply the membership with the weight from the triple
  6. Add that value to a dict for the related token and the matching queryterm (used to calculate nodes)
  7. Get the provenance, weight tuple for the relation triple
  8. Weight the provenance by the prov weight * relation weight * membership
prepare_for_query()¶

Returns FuzzySet containing tokens relevant to the query.

query.querystep module¶

dragn queries.

query.querystep.query(user_query=None, alias=None, lesser_edges=True)¶

Performs a query over texts as specified by the Alias. :param user_query: The query of the user. :param alias: The Alias of the texts. :param lesser_edges: Whether relations between nodes that are not in the query are to be considered. :return: A QueryResult object with the query performed.

query.querystep.with_graphvizoutput()¶

Runs query_step with GraphvizOutput, producing a call graph of all functions. :return:
